warmup

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • warmup.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board is a class that creates instances of Pingball boards which contain BoardObject objects (bumpers, balls,flippers, absorbers, and empty spaces).
    Author:
    enguyen, nconsul, spefley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int x, int y)
      Constructor that creates a new Board with given height and width.
      Board(int x, int y, Ball b, double bX, double bY)
      Constructor that creates a new Board with a given height and width, with a Ball at a given location on the Board.

    • Method Summary

      Method that determines whether a cell in the board is a part of the wall/edge.

      Returns the String representation of the Board.

      Updates the location of the ball in the board by taking the velocity and time into account.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int x,
     int y)
        Constructor that creates a new Board with given height and width. Each cell in the board is empty and contains an Empty object. The ball starts off the board at the top left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the width of the board
        y - represents the height of the board

      • Board

        public Board(int x,
     int y,
     Ball b,
     double bX,
     double bY)
        Constructor that creates a new Board with a given height and width, with a Ball at a given location on the Board. All spaces in the board without the ball are empty, with an Empty object.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the width of the board
        y - represents the height of the board
        b - represents the Ball that is in the board
        bX - represents the x-coordinate of the ball in the board
        bY - represents the y-coordinate of the ball in the board

    • Method Detail

      • isEdge

        public boolean isEdge(int x,
             int y)
        Method that determines whether a cell in the board is a part of the wall/edge. The edge is defined as being outside the board's dimensions, bordering the board.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x-coordinate of the cell in the board
        y - represents the y-coordinate of the cell in the board
        Returns:
        true if the cell is a part of the edge, false if the cell is a part of the board.

      • update

        public void update(double dt)
        Updates the location of the ball in the board by taking the velocity and time into account. Each of the coordinates are updated by the formula: newCoordinate = prevCoordinate + velocity * time. If the new coordinate values are not integers, they are rounded down. If the ball bounces off a wall, the boolean reflected is updated to true.
        Parameters:
        dt - represents the amount of time that passes before the ball updates its position.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of the Board. All edges are represented by "." and all cells in the board are represented by the String representation of the respective BoardObject in each cell. If a cell contains an Empty Object, it is represented by an empty String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
